meanings.definition: Moisture exuded through the pores of the skin, typically in profuse quantities when undergoing strenuous physical exertion.
meanings.sent1: After running a marathon, his shirt was soaked with sweat.
meanings.sent2: She wiped the sweat off her forehead after a long workout.
meanings.sent3: The sweat on his brow glistened in the sun like tiny diamonds.
meanings.sent4: The hard work poured out of him in streams of sweat.
meanings.sent5: The smell of sweat filled the gym, a testament to everyone's effort.

meanings.definition: To exude moisture through the pores of the skin, typically as a result of heat or physical exertion.
meanings.sent1: The athlete will sweat profusely during the intense training session.
meanings.sent2: Don't forget to hydrate when you sweat a lot during exercise.
meanings.sent3: The ice cream cone started to sweat in the hot summer sun.
meanings.sent4: The walls of the room seemed to sweat with humidity.
meanings.sent5: The stress of the situation made him sweat bullets.

meanings.definition: A state of anxiety or nervousness, often resulting in visible perspiration.
meanings.sent1: His palms were clammy with sweat before the big presentation.
meanings.sent2: The sweat on her brow betrayed her nervousness during the interview.
meanings.sent3: The detective felt the cold sweat of realization when he solved the case.
meanings.sent4: The sweat of anticipation dripped down his back as he waited for the results.
meanings.sent5: The sweat of fear made her heart race as she entered the haunted house.
